skill.name: doc-scanner
skill.description: Scans for project documentation files (AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, GEMINI.md, COPILOT.md, CURSOR.md, WARP.md, and 15+ other formats) and synthesizes guidance. Auto-activates when user asks to review, understand, or explore a codebase, when starting work in a new project, when asking about conventions or agents, or when documentation context would help. Can consolidate multiple platform docs into unified AGENTS.md.
skill.summary: Scans for project documentation files (AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, GEMINI.md, COPILOT.md, CURSOR.md, WARP....
skill.author: 0xDarkMatter

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation scanner skill. Uses Glob and Read to discover project documentation files (AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, etc.), synthesizes guidance, and optionally generates unified documentation. Filesystem access limited to project root documentation files. No network calls or external command execution.

content.value_statement: Teams waste time searching for project conventions and agent instructions scattered across multiple files. This skill automatically finds all AI assistant documentation (CLAUDE.md, AGENTS.md, COPILOT.md, and 20+ formats) and creates a unified reference guide.
actual_capabilities: Scans project root for 20+ documentation file formats (AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, GEMINI.md, COPILOT.md, CURSOR.md, WARP.md, and more)
Reads complete contents of all found documentation files
Synthesizes guidance into unified summary with recommended agents, workflows, and conventions
Consolidates multiple documentation files into single AGENTS.md with source attribution
Archives original documentation files with date suffixes in .doc-archive directory
Generates AGENTS.md template when no documentation exists
limitations: Only scans markdown documentation files in project root and hidden directories (.claude/, .cursor/, .github/)
Does not parse documentation in subdirectories except docs/AGENTS.md
Cannot analyze code to infer project conventions without existing documentation
Cannot modify code or execute commands in the project

use_cases.title: Unify scattered docs
use_cases.description: Combine CLAUDE.md, WARP.md, and other platform docs into single AGENTS.md for consistent team workflows

use_cases.title: Onboard faster
use_cases.description: Get instant overview of project conventions, recommended agents, and common commands from unified documentation

use_cases.title: Standardize guidance
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive AGENTS.md template based on project structure when documentation is missing

prompt_templates.title: Scan for docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Use doc-scanner to find all AI assistant documentation in this project and summarize what guidance exists

prompt_templates.title: Synthesize guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Use doc-scanner to read all documentation files and create unified summary of recommended agents, workflows, and conventions

prompt_templates.title: Consolidate docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Use doc-scanner to combine CLAUDE.md, CURSOR.md, and WARP.md into single unified AGENTS.md with source attribution

prompt_templates.title: Generate template
prompt_templates.prompt: Use doc-scanner to analyze this project structure and generate comprehensive AGENTS.md template based on patterns observed

output_examples.input: Use doc-scanner to find and summarize all AI assistant documentation in this project
output: - npm run dev: Start development server
- camelCase for functions, PascalCase for classes

best_practices: Run doc-scanner before starting work in unfamiliar project for immediate context
Consolidate documentation when multiple platform-specific files exist to reduce duplication
Update consolidated AGENTS.md when project conventions or workflows change
anti_patterns: Running doc-scanner without reading synthesized output - always review the summary
Consolidating documentation without backing up originals to .doc-archive
Generating AGENTS.md without verifying the content matches actual project practices

faq.question: What documentation formats does doc-scanner support?
faq.answer: Supports 20+ formats including AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, GEMINI.md, COPILOT.md, CHATGPT.md, CODEIUM.md, CURSOR.md, WINDSURF.md, VSCODE.md, JETBRAINS.md, WARP.md, FIG.md, DEVCONTAINER.md, and more.

faq.question: What file size limits apply?
faq.answer: No explicit limits. Very large documentation files (100KB+) may take longer to process but will be fully read.

faq.question: Does doc-scanner work with other tools?
faq.answer: Designed for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Output is platform-agnostic markdown that any AI assistant can read.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. Doc-scanner only reads documentation files you already have. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why is my documentation not found?
faq.answer: Check that files are in project root, .claude/, .cursor/, or docs/ directories. Ensure files use .md extension with correct naming.

faq.question: How is this different from manual file reading?
faq.answer: Doc-scanner automatically finds all documentation, synthesizes into unified summary, and can consolidate multiple files into one AGENTS.md.
